entry.title: Asset Management in SAP Cloud ERP Private | 2025 Release
entry.content:
Welcome to our deep dive into the latest advancements for Asset Management in SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 release. I am thrilled to walk you through the key highlights for this release, collected with close collaboration with our product management teams focused on asset management.

This collection is part of SAP features released on October 8, 2025.

You can find an overview of selected innovation highlights across all lines of business in the blog posts below:

SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 Product Release Highlights by Bert Schulze

SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 FPS0 Release Highlights by Harish Mangtani

In this blog post, we will explore updates on maintenance management apps, inspection checklist, further integration with Asset Performance Management, enhancements for Resource Scheduling (43R), and more.

This update introduces new capabilities to streamline your maintenance processes, enhance quality control, and improve operational efficiency. It is particularly relevant for maintenance planners, technicians, and other professionals involved on maintenance operations.

Table of Contents:

  • Updates on Perform Maintenance Jobs Fiori app (F5104A)
  • Updates on Manage Maintenance Orders app (F5241)
  • Updates on Manage Maintenance Planning Buckets (F3888A)​
  • Updates on Manage Inspection Checklists app (F6607)
  • Inspection checklist creation based on material in the maintenance order
  • Harmonize Document Management (HDM) in maintenance request apps
  • Work pack creation over the maintenance order lifecycle
  • Enabled maintenance event field in maintenance notification
  • Barcode-based filtering in the Find Maintenance orders app
  • Using SAP Fiori Maintain Default Values app for auto population while creating new work permit objects
  • Ability to Resubmit Action Required Subphase Requests in My Maintenance Requests app
  • Further integration with SAP Asset Performance Management (APM)
  • Enhancements in Resource Scheduling (RSH)
  • Spatial Asset Management
  • More information and links

Updates on Perform Maintenance Jobs Fiori app (F5104A) 

In the Perform Maintenance Jobs Fiori app (F5104A), users can find new features and customizing settings. Below, we present some highlights. Find in the SAP Help Portal the complete list of new features: Enhancements for Perform Maintenance Jobs App | SAP Help Portal

Display of long texts and documents

Failure Mode and Failure Effect fields now support long text display and document attachments directly within the app. This enhancement improves visibility into failure context during job execution. Technicians and planners gain immediate access to detailed failure information, improving diagnostic accuracy and reducing time spent searching for documentation.

Display of long texts and documents

Storage location and plant change for goods movement

Technicians can now change storage locations for planned components and plants for unplanned components during goods movement. A new customizing flag enables this functionality, and authorization checks are enforced to ensure compliance.

This feature increases flexibility in material handling, especially in dynamic field environments where technicians may need to adapt to local inventory constraints.

Storage location and plant change for goods movement

Barcode scan for unplanned material movement

A barcode scanning feature allows technicians to quickly add unplanned components by scanning material codes. This functionality is available directly in the Unplanned Components session as well as in the Add Unplanned Component popup and streamlines material handling during execution. Barcode scanning reduces manual input errors and speeds up the process of adding materials, especially in high-volume or time-sensitive maintenance tasks.

Barcode scan for unplanned material movement

Calendar view for job assignments

A new calendar view provides a visual representation of assigned jobs. Users can toggle between calendar and list views, filter by responsibility, and identify parallel assignments. Color coding indicates job status. Start and end dates are based on scheduled times, and overlapping operations are supported for better planning. The calendar view enables planners and technicians to manage time more effectively, prioritize tasks, and ensure timely execution of maintenance activities.

Calendar view for job assignments

Modernized time recording dialog

The new interface of time recording dialog prioritizes the most frequently used fields, according to work status, type of activity, long confirmation text and final confirmation flag.

When multiple employees record actual work, the system automatically calculates the remaining work based on cumulative entries. Additionally, users can modify or delete entries for additional employees, ensuring flexibility in time management.

Cross-app navigation via “related apps”

The object page now includes a “related apps” section for seamless navigation to associated applications such as Print Order, Work Packs, Maintenance Scheduling Board, and more.

Navigation is controlled via semantic objects and business catalogs assigned to user roles. Only authorized entries will be available for the user. Cross-app navigation reduces context switching and improves user efficiency by enabling quick access to related functions.

Cross-app navigation via “related apps”

Customizing control parameters

A new customizing framework replaces legacy controls for the Perform Maintenance Jobs app. It allows configuration per order type and planning plant combination. Migration to the new framework is automated via XPRA (ASM_XPRA_CONV_PMJ_CTRLP) during upgrades, with manual adjustments required for complex plant mappings. These adjustments will be needed, for example, for cases where multiple maintenance plant configuration existed for old data and have now to be mapped to single planning plant.​

This enhancement improves configuration flexibility and ensures consistent behavior across different maintenance scenarios.

Find more information here: New Customizing Activity for Perform Maintenance Jobs App | SAP Help Portal

Display of associated work permits

The 2025 release introduces the ability to display associated work permits directly within the Perform Maintenance Jobs app. As pre-requisite, the user must mark operation relevant for the work permit using the Manage Work Permits app. On the list page, two new filter groups in the Perform Maintenance Jobs app allows users to identify operations with work permit relevance or if it has work permit.

On the object page, a dedicated “Work Permits” section displays the current processing status of each permit, including work permit type, associated technical object, and attachments of the work permit. This integration improves compliance with safety protocols by making permit data readily accessible during job execution.

Check more details here: Integration of Work Permits in Perform Maintenance Jobs App | SAP Help Portal

Display of associated work permits

Confirmation scenario cooperation​

This release introduces a new cooperation confirmation scenario, designed to ensure that supporting technicians are aware of their participation in maintenance job history.

Now it is possible to generate a dynamic QR code, that allows a maintenance technician to record time confirmation on behalf of another one. The QR code is encrypted, valid for 90 seconds, and can optionally include a confirmation text. Static QR codes are also supported for long-term authentication, with traffic light indicators showing their validity status.

Find out how to implement this new feature here: Recording Cooperation With Other Technicians | SAP Help Portal

Confirmation scenario cooperation

Enablement of a verification process

The new verification confirmation scenario in the Perform Maintenance Jobs app enables a dual-control (four-eyes) principle for maintenance execution. This allows a second technician to verify the correctness of a performed job before final time confirmation is posted.

Verification can be planned at task list or order operation level, with indicators set as optional or required. Technicians use dynamic or static QR codes to authenticate verification. If verification is marked as required, the system blocks final confirmation until at least one verification entry is recorded. The verification status is visible in job lists and history, and multiple verifications are supported.

Find the implementation details here: Verification of Maintenance Jobs | SAP Help Portal

Enablement of a verification process - part I

Enablement of a verification process - part II

Updates on Manage Maintenance Orders app (F5241)

SAP S/4HANA 2025 brings a series of functional and usability improvements to the Manage Maintenance Orders app (F5241). These updates streamline order handling, improve visibility, and support more flexible planning and execution.

You can check more details and complete list of new features for this app in the SAP Help Portal: Enhancements for Manage Maintenance Orders App | SAP Help Portal

Displaying the document flow

Users can now access the document flow of a maintenance order directly from the order detail page via Functions → Open Document Flow, which opens the IW12 (Display Document Flow) application. This provides better traceability of linked documents.

Displaying the document flow

Creating a task list from a maintenance order

A new Create Task List button on the Operations and Resources tab allows users to generate task lists from selected operations and suboperations. The system proposes default values from the order and supports copying components, services, and attachments. The task list is not auto linked but can be manually assigned later.

Reassigning components and lean services

Components and lean services can now be reassigned between operations within the same order. This supports flexible resource allocation and simplifies adjustments during planning.

Cancelling the 'Do Not Execute' status

The system status NCMP (Do Not Execute) can now be cancelled directly from the list view or detail page using the Change Status button, allowing planners to reactivate previously blocked orders.

Cancelling the 'Do Not Execute' status

Changing scheduling details in list view

A new Change Scheduling button enables bulk updates to scheduling fields such as priority, basic start/finish, and assignment to maintenance events or revisions, directly from the list view. This includes the possibility to manage the assignment of the orders to a maintenance event or a revision.​

Changing scheduling details in list view

Updates on Manage Maintenance Planning Buckets app (F3888A)

The 2025 release introduces significant functional enhancements to the Manage Maintenance Planning Buckets app (F3888A), specifically designed to improve operational control and visibility in asset management scenarios.

A key enhancement is the ability to revert system statuses for planning buckets. With the new release, planners can now use the Change Status action to revert statuses (Technically Completed, Do Not Execute, and Deletion Flag) directly from the planning bucket detail page. This allows for greater flexibility in managing maintenance workflows, especially in cases where planning decisions need to be adjusted post-status assignment.

Change Status action to revert statuses

Another functional enhancement is the introduction of progress micro charts for event-based planning buckets. Two new columns (Completed Orders and Completed Notifications) have been added to the app’s results list. These columns feature micro charts that visualize the ratio of completed items to total assigned items, offering planners a concise and immediate view of maintenance progress across events.

These enhancements collectively improve the planner’s ability to manage maintenance events dynamically, reduce administrative overhead, and maintain accurate lifecycle tracking of maintenance activities.

Find out more here: Enhancements for Manage Maintenance Planning Buckets (New Version) App | SAP Help Portal

Two new columns (Completed Orders and Completed Notifications)

Updates on Manage Inspection Checklists app (F6607)

The 2025 release significantly improves the performance of the Manage Inspection Checklists app (F6607). Benchmark comparisons show up to 82% reduction in response times for key actions such as result recording and usage decision processing. These optimizations enhance responsiveness in wide-area network (WAN) environments.

Functional enhancements in the app include:

  • Implementation of the column “Number of Attachments” in the Inspection Lot tab and the Inspection Characteristics tab.
  • Cross-app navigation via a new action button for Display Results History
  • Enhancement of the Inspection Method, that allow users to navigate to the corresponding inspection method using a smart link.
  • New column Test Equipment 

These improvements accelerate checklist processing, reduce latency in high-volume environments, and support better decision-making through enhanced visibility and navigation.

Find out more in the presentation attached to the SAP Roadmap Explorer and Enhancements for Manage Inspection Checklists App | SAP Help Portal

Updates on Manage Inspection Checklists app (F6607)

Inspection checklist creation based on material in the maintenance order

The new release enables material-based checklist inspection for single or multiple material components that have no technical object master record. The inspection checklist process works for materials with and without serial numbers. The new feature is relevant, for example:

  • When spare parts need to be inspected before using or installing with respect to their condition or functionality
  • For maintenance process or service with Advanced Execution regarding dedicated serialized material
  • For refurbed serialized material by using a refurbishment order

It is possible to enable the material-based checklist inspection via the business function LOG_EAM_CHECKLIST.  The new checklist indicator shows options such as “no checklist”, “checklist without material planning” and “X checklist”.

The new feature eliminates the restriction of inspection checklist process for single technical objects. Instead, allow checklists for a quantity of material pieces. Moreover, it provides cluster functionalities for the material serial number checklists.

Find more information and implementation details at Checklist for Material Components | SAP Help Portal

Harmonize Document Management (HDM) in maintenance request apps

The new release has introduced a powerful enhancement for managing attachments across its maintenance-related Fiori apps: Harmonized Document Management (HDM). This feature enables seamless integration and flexible configuration of attachment handling processes across multiple document management frameworks, including Document Management System (DMS), Generic Object Services (GOS), and ArchiveLink.

HDM is now available in the following SAP Fiori apps: Create Maintenance Request (F1511A), Screen Maintenance Requests (F4072), My Maintenance Requests (F4513), Find Maintenance Notification (F2071) (view-only access to attachments).

By enabling HDM in these apps, organizations can harmonize the attachment lifecycle across different backend services, ensuring consistency and reducing complexity in document handling.

Check Harmonized Documents in Maintenance Request Apps | SAP Help Portal for more.

Harmonize Document Management (HDM) in maintenance request apps

Work pack creation over the maintenance order lifecycle

Lifecycle integration

Work pack creation is now supported across the entire maintenance order lifecycle, including both phase-enabled and non-phase-enabled processes. This enhancement allows planners and technicians to group operations into work packs at any stage, from order creation to business completion.

Phase-based processing includes stages such as initiation, planning, scheduling, execution, and post-execution. Non-phase-based processing follows a simplified order flow.

Customizing enhancements

New customizing options allow configuration of work pack types with phase and subphase and system status qualifiers. These qualifiers define inclusion or exclusion conditions for operations and orders:

  • Phase/subphase qualifiers for phase-enabled processes
  • System status qualifiers for non-phase-enabled processes

All conditions within a qualifier table must be met for inclusion in a work pack. This logic ensures precise control over which operations are grouped.

Learn more in the presentation file available on SAP Road Map Explorer

Work pack creation over the maintenance order lifecycle

Enabled maintenance event field in maintenance notification

The newly enabled maintenance event field allows users to assign a maintenance event directly to a maintenance notification. The maintenance event field allows users to filter, view, and assign maintenance notifications based on a maintenance event in SAP Fiori apps Screen Maintenance Requests (F4072)​, My Maintenance Requests (F4513), as well as WebDynpro apps and Maintenance Notification API. In both SAP Fiori apps, value help is available for selecting events, and once selected, the notification dates are auto filled.

This update brings users improved data consistency, enhanced filtering options, and reduced manual efforts and errors.

Enabled maintenance event field in maintenance notification

Barcode-based filtering in the Find Maintenance orders app

The 2025 release introduces a barcode scanning capability in the Find Maintenance Orders app (F2175), enabling automated filtering based on multiple attributes embedded in a scan code. This enhancement allows users to scan a QR code containing structured data, such as order number, work center, and technical object, and have the app automatically populate filter fields.

This feature speeds up order lookup, reduces manual entry errors, and supports integration with existing barcode systems, ideal for technicians working in fast-paced or mobile environments.

Find more information here: QR Code Scan Function for Filters in Find Maintenance Orders App | SAP Help Portal

Barcode-based filtering in the Find Maintenance orders app

Using SAP Fiori Maintain Default Values app for auto population while creating new work permit objects

SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 introduces the ability to auto populate key fields (such as planning plant, technical object, and maintenance plant) when creating new Permit to Work objects using the Maintain Default Values Fiori app. These defaults are automatically applied in creation dialogs and filter fields across related apps, including work permits, safety certificates, and templates.

When multiple default values exist, the system uses the first entry. These values are also auto populated in filter fields across apps like Manage Work Permit, Manage Safety Certificate, and Permit to Work Overview for Plant Manager.

This feature reduces manual input, ensures consistency across permit-related processes, and speeds up creation and filtering, especially useful for users managing permits across multiple operational contexts.

Using SAP Fiori Maintain Default Values app for auto population while creating new work permit objects

Ability to resubmit action required subphase requests in My Maintenance Requests app (F4513)

In My Maintenance Requests (F4513) app, users can now view, edit, and resubmit maintenance requests which are in action required subphase, created by other users for an approval. This is helpful when the creator of the maintenance request is not available to provide the required information.

You can enable this functionality by using the business function  LOG_EAM_MY_MAINT_REQ_CREATDBY  (My Maintenance Request: Created By). Earlier, only the user who created the request was able to edit it and submit the maintenance request.

This update empowers multiple users to manage and resubmit maintenance requests, reducing reliance on a single individual. Moreover, ensures continuity and flexibility in operations despite user absence, turnover, or retirement.

Further integration with SAP Asset Performance Management (APM)

Enhanced APM data visibility

The 2025 deepens integration between SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition and SAP Asset Performance Management (APM) through enhancements to the Find Technical Objects app (F2072). A new section displays APM recommendations, indicators, and assessments directly within the app. Semantic object navigation links allow users to explore technical objects from APM to review indicators, manage RCM/FMEA assessments, and access SAP S/4HANA measuring points.  Now, risk and criticality information is available directly on the header and it is possible to have and overview of assigned APM recommendations to the technical object.

This integration allows maintenance planners and reliability engineers to access performance metrics and risk evaluations directly within the technical object context, supporting proactive decision-making.

Enhanced APM data visibility

Failure data relationship for failure mode and failure effect

A key enhancement is the ability to use APM failure data relationships to select Failure Effects and Failure Modes during maintenance request creation and notification updates. These selections are enriched with long texts and attachments, providing full context for the failure scenario.

When a Failure Mode is selected, the system automatically assigns the corresponding task list to the maintenance request. This ensures that the correct procedures are followed based on historical failure data and APM recommendations.

This functionality is available in:

  • Create Maintenance Request (F1511A): Users can invoke the “Get Recommended Failure Effects” or “Get Recommended Failure Modes” dialog, which requires a technical object to be specified.
  • Screen Maintenance Requests (F4072): Failure Mode selection dynamically updates the assigned task list.
  • Perform Maintenance Jobs (F5104A): During notification changes, users can select Failure Effects and Modes via APM data, with a dialog showing detailed descriptions and attachments.

Failure data relationship for failure mode and failure effect

Find more information in the SAP Road Map Explorer. Check for regular updates on Asset Performance Management (APM) with Kate Dowle's blog posts and the link collection. 

Enhancements in Resource Scheduling (RSH)

The 2025 release introduces a broad set of usability and functional improvements across the Resource Scheduling (RSH) applications. 

New features in the Manage Schedules app

Rescheduling with a reason: You can move operations from a frozen, in-execution, or closed schedule to another schedule. This gives you greater transparency as you can record the reasons for rescheduling and include a comment. 

Filter for all available fields in list view: You can now filter data for all the fields in the list view showing the operations. This gives you full flexibility for working with the operation data in all the phases (planning, finalization, tracking execution, and reviewing).

Key improvements on Resource Scheduling - 1

 Redesigned schedule header: The design of the Manage Schedules header was improved to enhance usability with clearer labels and buttons and more compact presentation of the information.

New features in the Maintenance Scheduling Board app

Instant assignment of person responsible: You can now instantly assign the person responsible or the person to carry out the work to order operations when you choose them from the search results.

Key improvements on Resource Scheduling - 2

Joule integration for Maintenance Scheduling

Joule acts as a copilot, streamlining access to planning tools and reducing the need for manual navigation across SAP Fiori launchpad. It supports faster decision-making, reduces time spent searching for data, and improves responsiveness in dynamic maintenance environments.

The new release introduces Joule integration into Resource Scheduling apps, enabling conversational access to navigation. Joule can now respond to queries related to maintenance planning, provide contextual information, and offer direct links to relevant RSH applications, such as Manage Schedules, Maintenance Scheduling Board, or Work Center Utilization.

Joule Integration for Maintenance Scheduling 

 Key improvements

Accessing the Manage Work Center Utilization app from SAP Fiori Launchpad: A dedicated tile now allows direct access to the Manage Work Center Utilization app, improving navigation efficiency for planners.

Enabling integration of the Service with Advanced Execution service process: RSH apps now support billable maintenance orders from the Service with Advanced Execution service process. Service-specific fields (for example service order, item, product) can be used in filters and displayed in columns.

Key improvements on Resource Scheduling - 3

More flexibility when working with date ranges: In multiple apps, you can select the timeframe required more quickly. Based on the current date, you can choose a number of upcoming days, weeks, months, for example.

Clearer order selection in Gantt Charts: In the Gantt charts for Manage Maintenance Schedule for Orders and for Assets, if you selected the shape for an order or for multiple orders and then use the checkbox to select a different order, the shapes are deselected and vice versa.

Key improvements on Resource Scheduling - 4


Smart links for showing key data and enhanced navigation: Objects are shown as hyperlinks that you can follow to see a compact set of key data in a dialog window. Smart links are available in multiple apps for objects such as orders, operations, functional locations, equipment, and maintenance events. Users can also add personalized links to navigate to other apps.

Assigning team members to multiple teams: Team members can now be assigned to more than one team. A key user can configure the system so that a warning appears instead of an error message when person assigning team members tries to assign a team member to more than one team. The warning can be ignored.

Key improvements on Resource Scheduling - 5

Improved visibility of order and operation status: You can display the readiness status to easily identify whether a maintenance order is time-critical, whether the required materials and services are available, and whether the order has already been submitted for scheduling. This is possible not just at the level of orders but also for order operations.

Key improvements on Resource Scheduling - 6

Spatial Asset Management

Creating follow-on notifications for linear assets

This update enables the creation of follow-on maintenance notifications for linear assets with enhanced data continuity. Two scenarios are supported:

In the first, a follow-on notification is created in reference to a maintenance order. The system automatically transfers linear fields from the order header to the notification header, ensuring that asset-specific data is preserved across documents.

In the second scenario, a new notification is created based on an existing one, without establishing a relationship between the two of them. Even without linkage, the system copies all relevant data (including linear fields) from the source to the target notification. This approach supports flexible reuse of contextual data while maintaining document independence.

 Copying linear fields from maintenance notification header to maintenance order

Now it is possible to copy linear fields from maintenance notification header to maintenance order. When the notification is used as the reference object in the order header, linear fields are directly transferred to the order header. This ensures consistent asset data throughout the maintenance lifecycle.

Alternatively, when the notification is not the reference object in order header, the system transfers linear fields to the order’s object list. This indirect propagation maintains data integrity and supports flexible order creation workflows.

Creating geo-objects for notifications and orders based on phases and subphases

The 2025 release introduces geo-enablement for maintenance notifications and orders using the Geographical Enablement Framework (GEF). Notifications can now be visualized on a map based on their processing context, phase, and sub-phase.

Configuration involves defining Geo-Objects for different phases, enriching them with new fields such as Notification Processing Context, Phase Code, and Sub-Phase Code. Business Layers are created for each phase of the notification and rendered dynamically based on zoom level, allowing different geometries to be displayed depending on the scale.

These layers are integrated into the Spatial Data Explorer UI, enabling users to navigate hierarchies and view asset locations directly on the map. This enhancement improves spatial awareness and supports more informed decision-making in asset operations.

 

More information / additional links

Thanks for reading this blog post. Stay ahead by following the latest updates with the PSCC_Enablement tag in SAP Community.

entry.title: SAP Fiori for SAP S/4HANA – Minimum UX you need for SAP Business AI and Clean Core
entry.content:
SAP Fiori is the business user experience (UX) needed for SAP Business AI and Clean Core for SAP S/4HANA Cloud ERP Private.

  1. SAP Fiori is the primary way of bringing SAP Business AI to business users, including SAP’s digital assistant Joule. SAP Fiori is a prerequisite for embedded AI-assisted features and generative AI use cases.
  2. For Clean Core, SAP Fiori brings the SAP Fiori apps and user experience (UX) features needed for clean processes, extensions, and operations that supports your business users and your technical users through continuous innovation – including AI use cases.

IMPORTANT: To get the minimum UX in place quickly, there are more details below. Most importantly, be aware that:

  • Depending on your agreements, your SAP Enterprise Cloud Services (ECS) team may have already activated some prerequisites, or if not, can be requested to do this for you. 
  • For the quickest way to activate Joule refer to Joule provisioning with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition using Cloud Integration Automation service.  This CIAS automates 80% of the setup and guides you through the rest.

 

Joule diamond icon as it appears in the SAP Fiori launchpad shell bar

In this blog post you will learn why and the minimums you need to get started.

  • Why you need SAP Fiori in SAP S/4HANA Cloud ERP Private
  • How SAP Fiori works with Joule for business users
  • Minimum UX to get started with Clean Core
  • Minimum UX to get started with SAP Business AI
  • Learnings to support your UX journey

 

Why you need SAP Fiori in SAP S/4HANA Cloud ERP Private

From the beginning of SAP S/4HANA – now over 10 years ago – I have been explaining to SAP customers and partners, that SAP Fiori is how SAP delivers the innovations of SAP S/4HANA to business users.

The innovations of SAP S/4HANA include:

  • On-stack innovations – innovations available within your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition solution.
  • Side-by-side innovations – innovations that extend your solution with cloud services and cloud solutions.

Two (2) top of mind examples of these innovations are:

  • Clean Core processes, extensions, and operations. Many of these are on-stack innovations included in your solution as SAP Fiori apps and launchpad features.
  • SAP Business AI, including Joule – your digital assistant – and other AI use cases embedded with SAP Cloud ERP Private. These are side-by-side innovations that need flexibility, power, and scale of cloud resources to make them cost-effective.

SAP Fiori user experience is now over 12 years old and has matured to cover a vast range of business and technical processes, across many industries.  More than 3.5K apps are already available for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition. SAP Best Practices (found in the SAP Signavio Process Navigator) highlight the best of these new processes and apps.

SAP Fiori itself continues to innovate to make it easier for business users to work in new ways; on new device types; and caters for a broad range of working conditions and personal needs. For example:

  • My Home for SAP S/4HANA page introduced with SAP S/4HANA 2023 FPS01. The AI feature Recommended Apps has been added with SAP S/4HANA 2025,
  • Spaces and pages navigation introduced with SAP S/4HANA 2020 and improved with each SAP S/4HANA release, and
  • Keyboard Shortcuts dialog introduced with SAP S/4HANA 2025 for users who prefer/need keyboard navigation.

My Home for SAP S/4HANA in SAP S/4HANA 2025 showing Recommended Apps tab with recommendations from SAP Business AI

SAP Fiori apps apply consistent floorplans and behaviours that make them quick to learn – as per SAP Design System.  For example, Fiori Elements, Smart Business KPIs, and Review Booklets.  These floorplans are already Clean Core compliant, i.e. they automatically update with the latest improvements as you upgrade your SAP S/4HANA release, feature pack stack and/or SAPUI5 version.  This includes relevant AI-assisted features. Even when you have extended the app, clean core extensions such as Custom Fields and Adapt UI are retained.

Hint: If you need to custom-build your own app, using common floorplans greatly reduces development effort and change management effort.  Start your technical team at the UI5 Demo Kit section Developing Apps with SAP Fiori Elements.  Make sure they look at the Flexible Programming Model Explorer in the Resources section of the UI5 Demo Kit. Get them started with Joule for ABAP.

A major strength of the SAP Fiori launchpad is its ability to launch and easily navigate between SAP Fiori apps and classic UIs (including SAP GUI for HTML, ABAP Web Dynpro applications, WebClient UIs) and URLs. This includes your custom-built apps and (aka “Z”) transactions!

Hint: In workshops I like explain this as the new world of SAP Fiori understands the old world classic UIs and can cater for them.

More than 11.5K classic UIs are pre-configured as ready-to-use launchpad content for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition. While Best Practices highlight the best new processes, many quick win apps and features motivate users to move from the classic GUI into a web- and cloud-centric world, such as Search, Share/Bookmark, and Insight Tiles / Insight Cards. 

SAP Business Roles are templates that show how new apps and classic UIs work together to soften the pace of change.  You use the templates as a starting point for your own custom business roles.  By launching all processes from the launchpad, you retain useful classic Uis, combined with new value features, such as personalization, situations, search, embedded analytics, and app-to-app navigation.  For example: app F1873 Manage Sales Orders lets you simplify sales order creation by moving some order types to SAP Fiori and navigate to classic UIs for other order types.

SAP Fiori innovations help business experts and technical teams collaborate to efficiently manage change. It brings no-code/low-code clean core configuration and extension apps, features, and tools to help guide your business users and technical users as you improve your processes over time. For example: SAP Fiori app F1481 Custom Fields to extend end-to-end processes across Fiori apps, classic UIs, analytics, APIs, and much more. 

 

Example of adding Custom Fields to the business context Product General

 

Other important tools and features for managing change include:

  • Adapt UI within apps to control visible/hidden fields/tabs/tables/cards/charts, and provide role-based default settings for filters/tables/charts
  • WYSIWYG editors for launchpad layouts (apps Manage Launchpad Spaces and Manage Launchpad Pages) to communicate recommended/changing tasks for users’ assigned roles
  • Integration with Microsoft Teams for human collaboration
  • Integration with SAP WalkMe for context-sensitive guidance and user behaviour monitoring.

 

Hint: You can provide context-sensitive help via SAP WalkMe as per SAP’s strategic direction. If you have existing SAP Enable Now content, you can continue to use SAP Companion.

For an extended list of configuration and extension apps refer to SAP Fiori for SAP Fiori for SAP S/4HANA – Yes you need SAP Fiori to Configure, Adapt and Extend SAP S/4HANA. With SAP S/4HANA 2025, the new app F8438 Manage News for system news is a very welcome addition (think of it as the next generation of transaction SM02).  

Personal note:

  • At customers we are finding the My Home for SAP S/4HANA page motivates business users to move into the launchpad.  Experienced users like having these attractive personalization options to optimize their day.  For suggestions on how to make the most of this personalization refer to: SAP Fiori for SAP S/4HANA – Pro-tips for demonstrating SAP Fiori – Organizing your My Home page
  • New and time-poor users can be directed to start with the role-based layouts (spaces and pages) via the favorite pages assigned to their role(s). These layouts are easy to configure to reinforce the major processes, activities + on-system tasks of each role.  Layouts can be shared and optionally merged across similar roles.  Layouts respect authorizations by hiding unauthorized tiles, including hiding empty sections and empty pages.  For examples view the SAP Learning video Introducing SAP Fiori Launchpad for SAP S/4HANA Cloud [01:33] & further videos in Getting Started with Spaces and Pages. To create your own spaces and pages, refer to SAP Learning video Creating SAP Fiori Launchpad Layouts for Custom Business Roles [11:57]

 

How SAP Fiori works with Joule for business users

Business users authorized for SAP Joule access the Joule web client via the Joule icon on the SAP Fiori launchpad.  The Joule icon appears in the top shell bar of the launchpad – making it always available to business user whether they are in a SAP Fiori app or a classic UI.

 

Joule diamond icon as it appears in the SAP Fiori launchpad shell bar

 

SAP Fiori provides much more than a button to open a dialog window.

Both Joule navigational use cases and transactional use cases rely on the intent-based navigation of SAP Fiori when suggesting users take next steps in a relevant app.

You can find the apps of Joule navigational use cases in SAP Help - SAP Joule - Joule in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition – Finding Apps with Navigational Capability  The apps used in navigational use cases are SAP Fiori apps. The user must be authorized to launch the target app from the launchpad.

Example Joule navigational use case for show sales orders. More details are accessed through the Open button against each Sales Order/Item, navigating to the Manage Sales Order app

Joule transactional use cases enable users to quickly perform tasks in Joule instead of using an app, then optionally navigate to an app to check the result. The user must be authorized to perform the task, and to launch the target app from the launchpad.

Example prompts for transactional use cases with Sales Orders in SAP S/4HANA Cloud ERP Private

Hint: Target apps are launched by using SAP Fiori intent-based navigation. The intent is a Semantic Object + Action pair. You can find the matching apps and UIs using the tools of the Fiori Foundation Administrator role. For example: Launchpad App Manager, Launchpad Content Manager Client-Specific, or the read-only tool Launchpad Content Aggregator.

Most embedded AI use cases depend on using SAP Joule, accessing apps via SAP Fiori launchpad, and/or using key user tools in SAP Fiori. You can find the embedded AI use cases listed SAP Note 3558794 - AI Functionality in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition.

For example, AI-assisted Maintenance Order Recommendations you need:

  • SAP Fiori app F4470 Intelligent Scenario Management to train/activate the underlying AI model
  • SAP Fiori app F4604 Manage Maintenance Notifications and Orders for business users to use the AI

What about your own Joule use case created with SAP Joule Studio? Can you navigate to custom-built SAP Fiori apps or classic UIs for your own use cases? Yes, you can!

By using the intent-based navigation of the SAP Fiori launchpad to navigate to the relevant app or classic UI.  For some ideas on how agentic use cases may work with upcoming Joule Agents refer to High-Impact Use Cases of SAP Joule AI Agents

Minimum UX to get started with Clean Core

To get started with Clean Core, as a minimum you need to:

  • Activate your on-stack (aka local) SAP Fiori launchpad.
  • The activation process by default generates an every-user Fiori Foundation User role for basic launchpad access + a Fiori Foundation Administration role to manage your launchpad content and layouts.

Hint: Check with your SAP Enterprise Client Services (ECS) team  if this has been done already. For many customers launchpad activation will already have been done for you. If not, you can activate your launchpad yourself using the rapid activation task lists (refer to the section at the end of this blog post: Learnings to support your UX journey) or you can request your ECS team to do this for you.  You can also view previous runs of the task lists in transaction STC02 to check the details of what has been done. 

Depending on your starting point, you then need to activate one or more roles and assign these roles to your users, in addition to the every-user Fiori Foundation User role for basic launchpad access.

 

Summary of the 5 Clean Core Principles: Processes, Extensibility, Data, Integration, Operations

For Clean Core Processes, SAP Fiori delivers the SAP Fiori apps and features you will find in Best Practices, along with many other apps that support simpler, more consistent ways of working.

To get started with on-stack Clean Core processes, as a minimum you need to:

  • Activate the SAP Business Role(s) listed in your selected best practices

The rapid activation process creates a copy of the role in the customer namespace ready to refine. Once you have explored the role and the process, you then use the Fiori Foundation Administration role to refine it for your needs.  

For Clean Core Extensibility, SAP Fiori brings to business users (key users) and developers the Level A upgrade-safe, no-code/low-code - aka “key user” - tools you need to extend your business solution rapidly and cleanly. 

Hint: For the full Clean Core extension model refer to: Clean core extensibility for SAP S/4HANA Cloud. For a quick end-to-end on Clean Core references for your team refer to: “Business Excellence with SAP’s New Clean Core Extensibility Levels: Why, What and How”

To get started with on-stack Clean Core extensions, as a minimum you need to:

  • Activate the business role Extensibility Specialist (id SAP_BR_EXTENSIBILITY_SPEC).

Extensibility Specialist page showing the apps assigned

This role is assigned the major key user tools + the Adapt UI feature. You should assign this role to your key users – who may include business experts and your technical team.

To use Adapt UI, your key users will also need access to the app (or app variant) you want them to adapt. 

For further guidance and examples refer to: SAP Fiori for SAP S/4HANA – What is Key User Extensibility and Who are your Key Users

Depending on which apps and features you want to start with, you may also need the role Analytics Specialist for key user tools to manage your embedded analytics.  

Hint: The Analytics Specialist role includes the SAP Fiori app F2170 View Browser which provides a quick way to find released CDS Views for clean core extensions and integrations.

Example of the app View Browser in SAP S/4HANA 2025 FPS00 showing the app view Released Views for Key Users

For Clean Core Operations, SAP Fiori delivers administration and support tools to help you manage your solution, including your clean core processes and on-stack clean core extensions. For example, SAP Fiori app F1589 Register Extensions for Transport 

Example of app Register Extensions for Transport where key user extensions are assigned to transport requests

To get started with on-stack Clean Core operations, as a minimum you need to:

  • Activate the SAP Business Role Administrator (SAP_BR_ADMINISTRATOR) 

Hint: If your ECS team have activated your SAP Fiori launchpad for you, they will also have activated the Administrator role.

You should also apply the latest innovations for the App Support launchpad feature and make it available to all your launchpad users.  App Support provides an easy capture of logs, authorization errors, and technical details (app id, UI type, SAPUI5 version, device type, browser OS, etc) directly from the user’s session. You can even authorize your technical team to view/capture errors on behalf of the user.

Refer to:

  • SAP Help – SAP Fiori launchpad - Administration Guide – Launchpad Support Tools - Setting up App Support
  • SAP blog SAP Fiori for SAP S/4HANA – New improvements in App Support

 

Minimum UX to get started with SAP Business AI

For SAP Business AI, SAP Fiori launchpad provides business users access to SAP Joule, access to navigational and transactional capabilities, plus apps and tools that support embedded AI use cases.

To get started with SAP Joule, a side-by-side innovation, as a minimum you need to:

1. Meet commercial prerequisites

  • Have signed the relevant AI Terms and AI Usage agreements
  • Have subscribed to the cloud services needed for your AI use case

2. In your SAP S/4HANA solution:

  • Activate your on-stack (aka “local”) SAP Fiori launchpad
  • Activate the (SAP or custom) business roles you want to use with AI
  • Assign users to the business roles you want to use with AI

3. In SAP Build Work Zone solution:

  • Activate your unified (aka “central”) SAP Fiori launchpad on SAP Build Work Zone
  • Federate the content of your business roles from SAP S/4HANA to SAP Build Work Zone
  • Federate your user-to-role assignments from SAP S/4HANA to SAP Build Work Zone
  • Activate the Joule icon in your central launchpad and local launchpad

For the quickest way to make this happen refer to Joule provisioning with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition using Cloud Integration Automation service.  This CIAS automates 80% of the setup and guides you through the rest.

If you are new to SAP Build Work Zone and need some background on the architecture and other technical options, refer to Joule - Unified Setup: Bridging Simplicity and Performance.

For Joule prerequisites refer to SAP Note 3639572 - Enabling Joule with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition

For understanding your SAP Build Work Zone configuration you can refer to SAP Learning Journey: Setting Up SAP Build Work Zone standard edition and SAP Mobile Start with SAP S/4HANA

Which roles do you need to activate

For Joule navigational and transactional use cases, you will need to activate the roles (SAP Business Roles or equivalent custom roles) you need for your selected line of business (LoB) use cases.

You can find the list of current Joule use cases and their requirements in SAP Note 3523238 - Navigational and Transactional capabilities with Joule in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition.

For embedded AI use cases:

  • You will need to activate the roles (SAP Business Roles or equivalent custom roles) you need as explained in the use case documentation
  • You may also need to activate the role Analytics Specialist on your local launchpad. This role contains the apps to configure, train, and activate underlying machine learning and generative AI models. For example, app F4469 Intelligent Scenarios.

Hint: If your ECS team have activated your SAP Fiori launchpad for you, they will also have activated the Analytics Specialist role.

Hint: The documentation for each use case in the SAP Business AI discovery center explains which apps are required. 

 

Why 2 launchpads – the local and the central launchpad

The launchpad of SAP Build Work Zone (BWZ) acts a central access point to multiple cloud solutions.  To preserve the maximum functionality of the original solutions, the central launchpad launches apps in the local cloud solution.

SAP Build Work Zone federates the content – i.e. the roles, the layouts, the user assignments – from the local cloud solutions. It can also provide a central access point for federated features such as inbox tasks (SAP Task Center), notifications, searches, and more. These features also navigate to the relevant target app in the local launchpad.

The same is true for SAP Mobile Start which you should think of as the central launchpad on your mobile device, providing an online mobile entry point to apps and features.  Launching an app on a mobile device will reformat the appearance of the app and replace keyboard behaviours with mobile touch equivalents.

The implication is you must have a local launchpad as:

  • A source of launchpad content and layouts
  • A source of user-to-role assignments
  • As a target for launching apps and features.

Which launchpad should your user log into?  Either! It’s your choice. 

Once the prerequisites are met, you can choose to run Joule from the central launchpad or from the local launchpad.  This gives you some flexibility in both change management for users and consumption of services. 

In practice, this will depend on your preferences, subscriptions, and commercial agreements:

  • If all your users are covered under your SAP Build Work Zone subscription, and you are happy for your users to work over the internet, you direct them to the SAP Build Work Zone launchpad.
  • If your subscription only covers a portion of your user base, or you need to restrict internet access, you can split your user base to the 2 launchpads if you wish.

As a rule of thumb, you must activate the central launchpad for AI, mobile, and internet desktop use cases. The more cloud solutions and cloud services you use, the more value you will get from the central launchpad.

Some customers take a tactical approach while they grow scope and skills, by directing users who are primarily desktop/intranet to the local launchpad, while users who are primarily mobile use the central launchpad. 

 

Learnings to get you started

 

If your team is new to SAP Fiori, start with the SAP Learning Journey Learning the Basics of SAP Fiori. To keep your technical team aligned with your User Experience strategy:

  • For launchpad content administrators – SAP Learning video Bringing Apps Onto SAP Fiori Launchpad for SAP S/4HANA Cloud and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition [05:25] and SAP Learning Journey Designing SAP Build Work Zone
  • For security administrators - SAP Learning Journey:  Exploring the fundamentals of SAP System Security which includes SAP Fiori security and SAP Build Work Zone security.
  • For analytics specialists - SAP Learning Journey: Discovering SAP S/4HANA embedded analytics
  • For administrators: SAP Learning Journeys Implementing and Administering SAP Build Work Zone and Administrating SAP Business Technology Platform and to SAP Learning Journey: Setting Up SAP Build Work Zone standard edition and SAP Mobile Start with SAP S/4HANA

These are complemented by a growing number of short (max 12 minute) learning videos on SAP Learning for optional and self-managed tasks. For example:

  • Introducing SAP Fiori Launchpad for SAP S/4HANA Cloud

entry.title: SAP S/4HANA 2025 Release New Functions
entry.content:
• LoB Affected:
  • New Functionality Added:
  • Asset Management
  • Consumer Products
  • Cross Applications
  • Defense & Security
  • Finance
  • Insurance
  • Manufacturing
  • Public Sector
  • R+D/Engineering
  • Retail

  • Utilities

Hello Gurus 🙂

Today i want to share with you my quick dive into the SAP S/4HANA and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2025, and see what is the most significant new functions added to the newer version exclusively.

Hope this blog be useful for you.

LoB Affected:

  1. Asset Management

  2. Consumer Products

  3. Cross Applications

  4. Defense & Security

  5. Finance

  6. Insurance

  7. Manufacturing

  8. Public Sector

  9. R+D/Engineering

  10. Retail

  11. Sales

  12. Service

  13. Sourcing and Procurement

  14. Supply Chain

  15. Utilities

New Functionality Added:

below table is illustrating what's new of 174 added functionalities per each LoB:

Asset Management

  • Maintenance Management

    1. Harmonized Documents in Maintenance Request Apps: With the Harmonized Document Management (HDM) functionality, you can now harmonize the process of handling attachments across different document management frameworks such as Document Management System (DMS), Generic Object Services (GOS), or Archive Link according to your business requirements.
    2. Recording Cooperation With Other Technicians: With this feature, you can determine that maintenance technicians should only be able to record time for another technician by scanning a QR code presented by that person.
    3. Verification of Maintenance Jobs: With this feature, a maintenance technician who has appropriate authorization, can verify jobs performed by another maintenance technician in the Perform Maintenance Jobs app (F5104A). This way, the maintenance technician who is doing the verification provides a quality check based on the principle of dual control.
    4. QR Code Scan Function for Filters in Find Maintenance Orders App: With this feature, you can fill filter fields in the Find Maintenance Orders (F2175) app by scanning QR codes that contain the corresponding filter values. When you scan a QR code with the scanner in the filter area, the system automatically enters the scanned values into the relevant filter fields and executes the search immediately with the relevant results.
    5. New Filter Parameters for Maintenance Order and Maintenance Notification: This feature enables master data specialists to set up geospatial data on objects based on the phase, subphase, notification and order processing contexts. This will help the maintenance planners, supervisors, and technicians to visualize and manage maintenance activities with greater specificity and accuracy.
    6. Original Final Due Date: With this feature, you can view the original final due date in addition to the previous final due date when the final due date is changed in a maintenance notification or a maintenance order. The original final due date indicates the final due date that was initially determined for a maintenance activity, whereas the previous final due date indicates the final due date before the most recent change. This means that the original value remains visible even when the value is changed several times.
    7. Maintenance Order: Dispatch of Individual Operations: With this feature, you can dispatch operations and suboperations of a maintenance order individually. Previously, this option was only available for additional operations in emergency orders and in the apps for Resource Scheduling.
    8. Billable Maintenance Order: Phase-Based Maintenance Process: With this feature, you can use phase-enabled order types to process billable maintenance orders. However, there are some differences in the approval process for billable orders compared to other order types.
    9. Self-Healing for Partner Inheritance: Partner Inheritance transfers partner functions and details from superior technical objects to child technical objects. Self-healing detects and corrects any inconsistencies, maintaining alignment and data integrity across the technical object hierarchy. This process eliminates manual intervention, reducing administrative overhead and the risk of inconsistencies.

Consumer Products

  • Direct Distribution

    • Last Mile Distribution for Direct Distribution
      • Management of Visit List Schedules: This feature introduces visit list schedules for strategic visit list planning.

Cross Applications

  • Integrated Business Communications

    1. Integrated Business Communications: Enable business users to communicate with customers, suppliers, and service partners through personalized, trackable, and scalable messages leveraging business context. Provide this communication initially through e-mail, with more channels to follow.
    2. Log Extension for Customer/ Supplier EoP Check: This feature enables you to get additional log information on why a certain customer/ supplier couldn't be blocked in the system.
    3. Spool Access Method Q: You can use the access method Q in the SAP spool system to print using print queues.
    4. Flexible Data Provider Integration: With this feature, you can use an external data provider of your choice to search for and populate validated data when creating new business partner records. This saves time when creating and researching new business partners. This function is only available if you have licensed and set up the appropriate external data provider. This feature leverages cloud integration capabilities within the SAP Integration Suite. Pre-generated SAP Cloud Integration content is available for the CDQ data provider from the SAP Business Accelerator Hub. Note: This app is only available for cloud-ready mode.
    5. Data Context in the Extended Framework for Situation Handling: This feature enables you to also use data context in the extended framework for Situation Handling. Data context is business data from business objects involved in a situation instance that can be collected, distributed, and used for advanced analytics. If enabled in a situation type, data context is collected when a situation instance is created, updated, or completed.
    6. Custom SAP Object Types/SAP Object Node Types in Situation Objects: With this feature, you can use custom SAP object types and SAP object node types in situation objects.

Defense & Security

  1. Enhancements for the Critical Equipment: This product feature consists of various enhancements for the critical equipment: Migration for Critical Equipment Dismantling of Critical Equipment Technical Status Aggregation for Multiple Technical Status Profiles.
  2. Remote-to-Remote Server Communication Through the Central System: This feature provides the capability to use the central system to communicate from one remote server to another remote server in the same distributed landscape and then re-distribute the data. This supports the process of relocating technical objects and forwarding the notifications and work orders, assuring consistent data in the system landscape while operating at a remote site working offline in a communication-challenged environment.

Finance

  • Accounting and Financial Close

    • Closing Operations (SAP S/4HANA)
      1. Ad Hoc Set and Item in Selections: With this feature, you can use Ad Hoc Sets and Ad Hoc Items as dimensions in selections and validation rules.
    • Corporate Close (SAP S/4HANA)
      1. Additional Fields for Greenhouse Gas: With this feature you can activate a business function that enables you to process additional fields for greenhouse gas in group reporting.
      2. Additional Fields for Public Sector: With this feature you can activate a business function that enables you to process additional fields from the public sector industries in group reporting.
      3. Additional Fields for Financial Services: With this feature you can activate a business function that enables you to process additional fields from the financial services (FS) industries in group reporting.
      4. Display Master Data Change Log for FS Item: In the Define Financial Statement Items app, you can display a change log which shows all the changes that were done for a financial statement item (FS item).
      5. Release Universal Journal: Support of Prior Periods Mode: The release universal journal task now supports two prior periods modes for the accounting integration with group reporting preparation ledger: One for complete data in prior periods and one for delta data in prior periods.
      6. Cross-Version Balance Validation: With this feature, you can define validation rules that can compare figures between two consolidation versions, for example, Actuals vs Budget.
      7. Overwrite Rule Control Level for Balance Validation: With this feature, you can change the message type from Error to Warning for the balance validation tasks with task category Balance Validation in Accounting in the Define Balance Validation Tasks configuration activity.
      8. Transfer Service Objects to Another Service Center (Intracompany Transfer): Once the service objects have the availability Received by Service Center, you can now transfer them to another service center at which the in-house service is to be performed. You launch this logistics process in the Manage In-House Service Objects (F7695) or Manage In-House Services (F4025) app by creating an outbound delivery. The subsequent process steps that are required to post the service objects to the new service center, are performed in Delivery Management (LE-SHP).
      4. Post Service Objects to Customer Stock: Previously, when launching the returns process for service objects in the Manage In-House Services (F7695) and Manage In-House Service Objects (F4025) apps, the incoming service objects were posted to the sales stock (special stock indicator Orders on Hand / E). You can now post the service objects to the special stock indicator Customer Stock (B), if you've specified this in Customizing.
      5. Specify Plant and Storage Location in Service Objects When Creating Returns Orders: When creating a returns order for service objects in the Manage In-House Services (F7695) and Manage In-House Service Objects (F4025) apps, you can now specify the plant and the storage location to which the service object is posted. If you do not enter a plant and a storage location, the system uses the plant and storage location that have been configured for customer returns.
      6. Receive Service Objects Using Inbound Deliveries: When receiving service objects from customers, you can now launch the logistics process by creating an inbound delivery in the Manage In-House Services (F7695) and Manage In-House Service Objects (F4025) apps. Previously, it was only possible to launch the logistics process using the integration with customer returns.
      7. Search for Note Texts in Service Transactions: It's now possible to use Enterprise Search to search for note texts in service transactions. The feature allows you to quickly find all service transactions that contain a specific note text, such as a problem description in a service order or customer instructions in an in-house service.
    • Service Order Management
      1. Rejection Reasons for Service Transactions: You can now create rejection profiles that contain predefined rejection reasons for service transactions such as service contracts, service quotations, and service orders. This feature enables you to customize your own rejection reasons and group them in a rejection profile according to your business requirements. You can then assign a rejection profile to a service transaction type. With this, when you reject a service transaction or an item in the transaction, you can select from a group of reasons for the rejection.
      2. Support of HDM for Attachments in Service Orders: You can now use Harmonized Document Management (HDM) to manage attachments in service orders. HDM enables the use of Document Management (DMS) that offers enhanced functionality compared to the previously supported Generic Object Services (GOS). DMS allows you to independently search for, access, reuse, rename, and version attachments.
      3. Release Button for Service Orders and Service Order Templates: Previously, you could only set the status of a service order to Released in edit mode and save it manually. Now, you can release a service order in display mode by choosing Release in Manage Service Orders app. With this new button, you can release the service order along with its items in one go, which is less time-consuming.
      4. Facets on Overview Pages of Service Transactions: You can now use facets on overview pages of service quotations, service orders, and service confirmations. The facets provide a structured display of relevant key fields on the header and item levels in a harmonized manner. Using facets allows you to quickly view important data without navigating through the entire object details.
      5. Service Hierarchy in Intercompany Service Process: You can now use the concept of service hierarchy with collective accounting in intercompany service processes. The feature allows you to define intercompany items as main items and subitems in a service hierarchy. Costs incurred by the intercompany service order are collected under the account assignment object of the intercompany item specified as the main item in the service hierarchy.
      6. Planned Cost and Revenue for Unplanned Items: You can now calculate planned cost and revenue – both baseline and ongoing – for unplanned items in a service order. This feature is especially useful if you use the event-based revenue recognition method Recognize Revenue on Cost-Based Percentage of Completion (POC), and the unplanned items are created as subitems of the main item in a service hierarchy.
      7. Multiple Revenue Accounts for Planned Cost and Revenue: Account determination for planned revenue has been enhanced to better support revenue recognition in service orders using the cost-based percentage of completion (POC) method. Previously, only a single revenue account was used for the planned revenue of a service order item, based on its active price condition. Now, it's possible to use multiple revenue accounts, each corresponding to a price condition or discount/surcharge that contributes to the planned revenue. This enhancement ensures that the planned revenue accounts are more closely aligned with actual revenue postings, improving financial accuracy and reporting.
      8. Tool Items in Service Transactions: You can now enter tools for the following service transactions in order to bill them to your customers and to determine and allocate internal costs: Service orders, service order templates, and service quotations (item categories: SRVT, SRTT, SRQT) Service confirmations (item category SVCT).
      9. Editable Fields in Output Control: You can now edit fields under Output Control in service orders, service quotations, service contracts, and solution quotations. Previously, these fields were read-only. This feature allows you to customize output settings for service transactions to meet specific needs, for example, to edit the output queue.
      10. Profit Center Reorganization in Service: This feature supports profit center reorganization in service transactions to align with organizational changes that take place in your company. During the reorganization process, profit centers and/or segments are reassigned and their stocks or balances are reposted to the new organizational entities.
      11. Plant and Storage Location in Service Transactions: The plant and storage location can now be automatically determined and displayed when the service transaction item is entered. You can also manually change the plant and storage location in the Items assignment block. If you manually change the plant and then want to change it back to the original value, you can use the Redetermine Plant/Location button in the Items assignment block.

Sourcing and Procurement

  • Central Procurement

    • Central Purchase Contract Processing
      1. Custom Split Criteria for Central Purchase Contracts: This feature allows you to customize how the Central Purchase Contracts are split and distributed to connected systems based on plant, storage location, and custom fields.
    • Central Purchasing
      1. Addition of New Fields in Purchase Order Extraction: This feature enables you to extract the Shipping Instruction and Price Printout fields from Purchase Orders (PO), both taken from the item-level fields in the PO data.

  • Operational Procurement

    • Purchase Order Processing
      1. Aggregation of Lean Service - Related Purchase Order History Items: This feature enables you to include lean service standard items as well as enhanced limit items in transaction ME87(Summarization and Removal of PO History Records).

  • General

    1. Allow Posting of Non-Valuated Good Receipts to Service Entry Sheets: This feature enables you to allow posting of non-valuated good receipts to Service Entry Sheets (SES).
    2. Service Master Data Migration Report to SAP S/4HANA: This feature enables you to transition from using MM-SRV in SAP S/4HANAto the Lean Service Product model. By running the RMMSRV_SRVMSTR_MIG_TO_S4 report, it converts your existing Service Master Data into the Lean Service Product format. This ensures your data aligns with the structural requirements of the SAP S/4HANA system, making the migration process smooth for our existing customers.
    3. Migration of Service Purchase Orders to Lean Services in SAP S/4HANA: This feature enables you to close existing service-based purchase order (PO) data from legacy tables and create new ones in the Lean format. Lean Services is SAP’s strategic solution for Service Procurement moving forward. While MM-SRV remains available, it will no longer receive functional enhancements.
    4. Migration of Service-Based Purchasing Contracts to Lean Contracts: This feature enables you to migrate service-based purchasing contracts from MM-SRV to Lean Contracts in the SAP S/4HANA system, based on user-defined input. It allows users to choose whether the migrated contracts should be created as hierarchical structures or as flat item lists.
    5. Mapping MM-SRV Document Types to Lean Services: This feature enables you to define a mapping between classic MM-SRV document types and their corresponding Lean Service document types in SAP S/4HANA .
    6. WBS Element Available in Service Entry Sheet Upload Template: This feature enables you to input the WBS Element directly in the Service Entry Sheet (SES) upload template instead of the internal WBS Element ID number.
    7. New Fields for Service Entry Sheet (Lean Services) API: This feature enables you to use the two new service-related fields Budget Period and Grant ID in the Service Entry Sheet (Lean Services) API.
    8. Non-Valuated Goods Receipt Supported in Purchase Requisitions: This feature enables you to define in the purchase requisition (PR) whether the goods receipt (GR) for a service should be non-valuated. The setting is transferred to the purchase order (PO) and determines how the GR is handled when posting the Service Entry Sheet (SES).

Supply Chain

  • Advanced Order Promising

    • Advanced Available to Promise
      1. ATP Categories in Availability Change Log: With this feature, the Availability Change Log (ACL) framework now records the ATP category along with the material, plant, MRP area, date, and time details for selected documents.
      2. Pool Segment as Planning Level in Supply Protection: This feature enables you to use pool segments as an additional planning level in supply protection. This allows the setup of supply protection, for example, for a specific quality grade. In such a case, supply protection could be set up in such a way that the articles with the highest quality are reserved for special protection groups such as key customers, whereas there isn't any restriction in place for lower-quality articles.
      3. Maximum Sequence Number in Alternative Determination: With this feature, you can use a new rating attribute to determine alternative confirmations for a requirement.
      4. With Creation of Stock Transport Document: With this feature, you can simplify logistical processes by triggering the automatic creation of transport orders to move stock from substitute plants or storage locations to the plant or storage location originally requested in an order.
      5. Rounding Confirmations in Sales Documents: With this feature, you can use rounding for confirmed quantities in sales orders and stock transport orders.
      6. Ability to Override Existing Confirmation Constraints: With this feature, users can override any existing Product Availability Check (PAC), Product Allocation (PAL) or Supply Protection (SUP) constraints to allocate confirmation to a requirement.
      7. Optimistic Reservation of Quantity: With this feature, you can configure the type of quantity reservation that is to be applied when the availability for a requested product is checked.
      8. Calculation of Supply and Demand for Subcontracting: With this feature, you can now configure how supply and demand is considered for product availability checks involving subcontracting scenarios.
      9. Batch as Planning Level in Supply Protection: This feature enables you to use batches as an additional planning level in supply protection. This allows for the protection of a specific batch of a vaccine. Batch identification can also be relevant for paints, chemicals, cosmetics, food, etc. In such a case, supply protection can be set up in a way that the quantities of a specific batch are reserved for special protection groups, while there isn't any restriction in place for other batches.
      10. Overprotection Alert in Supply Protection: Use this new standard template (CA_ATP_SUP_OVERPROTECTION) if you want your order fulfillment managers to be informed when the restrictions defined in Supply Protection lead to a critical availability situation when protected quantities are too high. Recipients can get notifications whenever the availability situation in combination with Supply Protection leads to a complete lock, or if single supply protection objects or single protection groups of related supply protection objects are locked.
      11. First Come First Served (FCFS) in Backorder Processing (BOP): With this feature, the system ensures that the availability check gives priority to earlier sales documents and stock transport orders even when later orders are altered.

  • Delivery and Transportation

    • Transportation Management
      1. Ocean Freight Tendering: With this feature, you, as a shipper, can use the direct tendering (non-RFQ) process to send a tendering plan or ocean freight booking directly to the carriers.
      2. Key Performance Indicators in the Transportation Cockpit: With this feature, you can display and evaluate key performance indicators (KPIs) in the transportation cockpit.
      3. Calculation of Distances Traveled with or Without Load: This feature enables you to have visibility regarding distances that are traveled either with or without load and whether the corresponding transportation stages are empty or not. Based on this information, you are able to measure the efficiency of your fleet by calculating the ratio of the distance traveled with load and the total distance, for example.
      4. New Handling Execution Status: Cargo Ready for Loading: With this feature, you can use the handling execution status Cargo Ready for Loading, which, when so customized, starts the creation of customs invoice and export declaration before the goods are loaded onto a truck in an Advanced Shipping and Receiving process.

  • Inventory

    • Extended Service Parts Planning
      1. Assign Location Product-Specific Segmentations (Clusters): With this feature, you can assign location product-specific segmentations (clusters) to parts in the product master data within SAP S/4HANA and use them in the Extended Service Parts Planning processes. Clusters serve to group location products of the same kind. You define a cluster type for the criterion with which the clusters are to be formed.
      2. Consideration of Lead Time Variability in Multistage Safety Stock Calculation: This feature enables you to consider lead time variability measures when running the Multistage Safety Stock PSM service.
      3. Forecast Adjustment: This feature enables you to modify forecast results using a factor or a specific value. If you anticipate an increase or decrease in demand, you can adjust the forecast.
      4. OEM-Managed Inventory: With this feature, you can plan the stock of selected dealers. In this way, you can support these dealers in optimizing their procurement planning and stock situation. Furthermore, these dealers no longer need to order from you actively; as the original equipment manufacturer (OEM) and owner of Extended Service Parts Planning (eSPP), you trigger the transfer of stock to a dealer location for normal replenishment.
      5. Stock Monitoring Demand vs. Stock: This feature enables you to proactively manage inventory by providing timely notifications when stock levels fall below a critical threshold compared to the recent demand history quantity. This is particularly important for industries where maintaining the availability of specialized parts is a significant challenge.
      6. Stock Monitoring Phase-Out Forecast vs. Stock: This feature enables you to effectively manage the availability of End of Production (EOP) parts, supporting compliance with business and legal requirements for Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs). It addresses the challenges faced when suppliers discontinue the supply of EOP parts.

  • Warehousing

    • Warehouse Management
      1. Handling Execution Status: Cargo Ready for Loading: With this feature, you can set the handling execution status of a freight order to Cargo Ready for Loading or Cargo Not Ready for Loading in the Load or Unload Freight Orders app. You can use this feature if you want to conduct customs processes before a truck arrives at your warehouse.
      2. Reverse Goods Receipt after Final Put away for Stock from External Procurement: With this feature, you can also reverse goods receipt for stock from external procurement after final put away.
      3. Batch-Specific Units of Measure in Decentralized EWM: This feature enables you to work with batch-specific units of measure in decentralized Extended Warehouse Management (EWM) based on SAP S/4HANA during inbound, outbound, and internal warehouse processes, for example, physical inventory, warehouse-internal movements, or change posting.

Utilities

  1. New Time-Dependent Attributes for the Point of Delivery: In certain markets, for example in Germany, a point of delivery (referred to as the market location in Germany) can be changed to a “dormant” status. Besides this new status, additional attributes must be also added as time-dependent to the point of delivery.
  2. Setup Date Fields of Utilities Contract: Customizing settings for automatic setup of date fields in Utilities contracts allows users to efficiently manage contract durations, renewal dates, and other scheduling data. This feature is essential for ensuring accurate and streamlined contract management processes with Utilities sales contracts.
